intro: Andryala mogadorensis subsp. jahandiezii, commonly known as the Canary Islands spurge, is a rare flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the arid and coastal climates of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
